artist: Artist: Mark di Suvero; Publisher: Gemini G.E.L., Los Angeles; Fabricator: Gemini G.E.L., Los Angeles
description: five curvilinear, irregular shapes that can be joined together in multiple fashions and interlock together in a flat configuration
dimension:
15 1/4 x 33 1/4 x 17 1/2 in. (38.74 x 84.46 x 44.45 cm) (approx., as assembled in three dimensions)
17 x 20 7/8 x 3/4 in. (43.18 x 53.02 x 1.91 cm) (as assembled in flat configuration)
markings: on side of each piece, stamped: [40/50]; see Signed
provenance: Peregrine Capital Management (Wells Fargo), Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2012
signed: on piece with round element, incised: [Mark di Suvero]; on side of piece with round element, stamped: [MdS R (c) (symbol) 1980]
text:
American sculptor Mark di Suvero is widely recognized for his powerful large-scale 
abstract sculptures made from welded steel beams, metal plates, and scrap industrial materials. Some of the sculptures are stationary; others are designed to be kinetic, incorporating parts that can move freely in space. Di Suvero’s work is grounded in abstract expressionism, conveying emotion through line, color, material, and most importantly, the active engagement of space. Rising (for Walt Whitman) is a small-scale exploration of these ideas, where variable spatial and formal relationships provide a conceptually nuanced work of art that invites close inspection.
title: Rising (for Walt Whitman)
